thread.title: Brad Kaaya, Rashawn Scott lead Miami Hurricanes in win over Virgina Tech
thread.title_full: Brad Kaaya, Rashawn Scott lead Miami Hurricanes in win over Virgina Tech

author:
Susan Miller Degnan 
sdegnan@miamiherald.com
title: Brad Kaaya, Rashawn Scott lead Miami Hurricanes in win over Virgina Tech
text:
Brad Kaaya, Rashawn Scott lead Miami Hurricanes in win over Virgina Tech 
UM QB Brad Kaaya and WR Rashawn Scott connect for two TDs 
Hurricanes rebound to win first ACC Coastal Division matchup 
Next up for Canes: fifth-ranked Clemson at Sun Life Stadium UM wide receiver Rashawn Scott (11) scores in the second quarter as Virginia Tech’s Anthony Shegog (24) fails to make a stop as the University of Miami hosts Virginia Tech at Sun Life Stadium on Saturday, October 17, 2015. AL DIAZ adiaz@miamiherald.com i Order Reprint of this Story 
They’re back on track. 
The Miami Hurricanes forced four turnovers, scored 10 points off two of them, and rode Brad Kaaya’s right arm Saturday to a 30-20 victory over Virginia Tech at Sun Life Stadium. 
Kaaya threw for 296 yards and two huge touchdowns – both to Rashawn Scott near the end of each half. 
Outside linebacker Trent Harris recovered a fumble, cornerback Artie Burns had two interceptions – the last one with 2:29 remaining in the game – and linebacker Juwon Young had an interception to secure the victory. 
Running back Joe Yearby scored a touchdown after Harris’ fumble recovery, and Michael Badgley added three field goals, including a career-long 49-yarder for the Hurricanes. 
After consecutive losses at Cincinnati and Florida State, the Canes got their first Atlantic Coast Conference win and first in the Coastal Division to raise their record to 4-2 and 1-1. 
Virginia Tech fell to 3-4 and 1-2. 
The win was not without a loss. Starting middle linebacker and team captain Raphael Kirby left the game with an apparent knee injury, one that could be serious, in the third quarter. 
The Hurricanes meet No. 5 Clemson next Saturday at Sun Life. The Atlantic Division Tigers, who haven’t been to Miami since 2009, was set to host Boston College on Saturday night.
